intro: Alyogyne, commonly known as the native hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are native to Australia and are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers. Alyogyne species typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. They are often found in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
